page.title: 09DAIRY FARM __ continued.
page.content: spread on the fields.The cows eat it from the shed,their movement regulated by an electric fence,moved a few centimetres daily.This continues into late spring.On average a cow will feed on 8 tonnes of silage during winter. {STOCK _}80 Scotch Half Bred ewes and 2 Texel rams keep the land well cropped. The Texel gives leaner meat. Contract shearers are used,the wool sent to the British Wool Board.Lambs are slaughtered locally.Orphan lambs are adopted by another ewe using an adopting pen for three days.Other livestock include a few guinea fowl, pheasants and two gun dogs. Fields are re_seeded every 5_6 years and injected annually with nitrogen. {LABOUR _}Three full time staff working weekdays 6.30am to 6.00pm and a rota of 4.5 hours per day at weekends.
